Make staying hydrated even more fun for the kids with a set of plastic Rainbow Tumblers, &pound3 (half price).  Be skin-savvy Being outside in the sunshine is enjoyable, but its UV rays can do lasting damage to your skin. Applying a high SPF sun cream is vital - but it's also best to avoid exposing your skin to direct sun for prolonged periods, especially between midday and 3pm, when the sun is strongest. This is especially important for kids. So with a cloudless, beautiful summer sky you're going to need to create some shade. If you're at the beach, then a dedicated shelter will help. Halfords' Beach Shelter offers a 30+ UV protection. If you're spending most of the day out in the garden and the kids are in and out of the paddling pool, you may need more protection. The Halfords 300 Gazebo costs just &pound69 ( was &pound90, save &pound21) and has a UV 50+ rating.  When choosing a gazebo or shelter for the sunny weather it's worth understanding those UV protection numbers. With a 50+ rating the gazebo should stop around 97 to 98 per cent of the UV radiation from the sun. This, combined with sun cream will help keep you all much safer. With any gazebo you might also want to consider some weights to go along with it. Just because it's sunny, doesn't mean it can't also be a bit blowy out! Baby, it's hot outside The hot weather can feel uncomfortable for adults, but it's particularly important to keep babies in the shade - as they are less able to sweat to cool down and their skin is very sensitive. So it's worth investing in a stroller or pram with a decent sun visor if you are taking your little one out and about in the sun.  The Joie Mirus Scenic Stroller, &pound120, is an affordable modern stroller which comes with a SPF 50+ sun canopy. (It can also be paired with either the Joie Gemm or Joie Juva Infant Car Seat, to create a travel system, with no adapter needed.)  For playing in the garden or trips to the beach, grab the Halfords Infant Playshade, &pound25. It pops up and down in less than 10 seconds and is made from specially tested material that provides a 50+ UV protection factor. Stay cool in the car  It's fair to say we love most things about summer, but getting into a hot car on a sweltering day isn't one of them. Did you know your air conditioning loses charge every year, making it less efficient and making your car warmer? Halfords now offers a FREE Air Con Check, to check your refrigerant levels and see if they need to be topped up for optimal performance. If they do need topping up, you can purchase air con essentials from store to recharge at home or, you can book in for an air con recharge service and Halfords can take care of it for you. You can also keep out the worst of the heat by investing in a windscreen shield to reflect the sun's glare. The Halfords All Weather Windscreen Shield is just &pound7.99 - and when winter eventually does roll around, you can also use it to protect against the build up of snow and frost.

title: identical twins lose 14 stone
story: NewsIdentical twins lose 14 stone TOGETHER after they wanted to still look the sameLindsey Taunt and Kirsty Baker discovered they both share a genetic condition that can increase the risk of heart attacks - and its made worse by being overweight&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByLucy Laing20:01, 7 JUL 2018NewsIdentical twins Lindsey Taunt (left) and Kirsty (right) Baker (Image: Worldwidefeatures)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIdentical twins Lindsey Taunt and Kirsty Baker share everything. So when Lindsey decided to tackle her weight, Kirsty did too – as she wanted to still look the spitting image of her sister. With each other for support and inspiration, the twins lost 14st between them. And it may have saved their lives – as doctors have discovered the two share a genetic condition that can increase the risk of heart attacks, which is made worse by being overweight. Kirsty, 34, said: “There was no way when Lindsey started to lose weight that I was going to be left behind as the fat twin. Losing weight with an identical twin is like watching your own progress in a mirror. “We couldn’t have done it alone. Doing it together is what kept us going.  “Seeing my gorgeous slim twin sister is a constant reminder not to overeat. It’s the best incentive we could both have.” The sisters put on weight after their dad died unexpectedly in 2007. Kirsty, who lives in Wrexham with husband Matt, 35, said: “Lindsey and I were both devastated when we lost our dad and we ate our way through our grief, trying to get comfort from it. Our weight rocketed. “Then when I gave birth to my daughter Olivia, now nine, my weight went up even further. Our weight was making us both miserable. Whenever we got together we’d commiserate over a giant pizza. We were fat but at least we had each other.”  At their heaviest, Kirsty weighed 16st 4lb and Lindsey weighed 17st 9lb. Then Kirsty had a heart attack when she was 25 weeks pregnant with son Evan, now four, in 2013. She said: “Thankfully I was all right and Evan was born healthy. But doctors discovered the heart attack was caused by a genetic blood clotting condition Lindsey and I shared. “They said my weight was a contributing factor. So we had to do something about it.”

title: meghan markle hasnt adopted english
story: NewsMeghan Markle hasn't adopted an English accent - it's actually a clever mind trickFans of the Duchess of Sussex recently thought her voice sounded different, but as a leading linguist points out, this is impossible&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByZahra MulroySocial Audience EditorZoe ForseyAudience Writer17:21, 7 JUL 2018Updated17:47, 7 JUL 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSince her wedding back in May, Meghan Markle has barely put a foot wrong.  This is quite an achievement. Becoming a duchess isn't just about wearing expensive designer threads and accepting flowers from cute kids (though that is a large part).  There's all the rules she must now follow as the Duchess of Sussex, and it's a big leap from Hollywood to one of the most famous and traditional families in the world. So you can't hold it against her for wanting to fit in.  Recently it even seemed as if the Suits actor had adopted an English accent .  It's not the first time Meghan's accent has come under scrutinty.   Earlier this year she was accused of putting on British accent after saying the word 'scone' .  A new clip which recently emerged from her visit to Cheshire with the Queen, has convinced royal fans that they can hear a change in her voice. Meghan is speaking with well-wishers and shaking their hands, when one woman says: Welcome to Chester. She replies Thank you, I really appreciate that with the 'thank you' in particular sounding very British. But that's apparently not the case.  If we do think Meghan sounds more English, then that's down to us - not her. Professor of linguistics at Oklahoma State University, Dennis Preston, reveals that any perceived change is in fact down to our brain playing tricks on us.  She married an Englishman, she lives in England, she's hanging with the Queen, and people think, 'Gosh, she must be doing something with her language,' he told Yahoo .     Essentially, our brain gets in the way of our ear. So we hear what we expect to hear, rather than what we actually do. He went on: I did a very careful listen, paying specific attention to her vowels, a big giveaway with British accents, as well as the intonation. I just didn’t find anything resembling a British accent. There’s nothing there.

title: mum who makes cream claims
story: NewsMum who makes cream she claims can help beat cancer battles French probe over “illegal pharmacy”Lesley Hutchings says she had her passport taken away and her bank accounts emptied after being held for four days over allegations of defrauding customers&nbspShareByGrace Macaskill 22:29, 7 JUL 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShareGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA British mum who makes a cream she claims can help beat cancer is battling a French probe accusing her of having an “illegal pharmacy”. Lesley Hutchings says she had her passport taken away and her bank accounts emptied after being held for four days over allegations of defrauding customers. Lesley, 54, was quizzed by French authorities about the cream – which she makes in her barn. The product sells on Facebook for up to &pound40. Police who raided her home in the remote Manche area of Nor&shymandy removed computers and paperwork before sealing up the outbuilding. Officials then took away samples of her MAFactive cream for tests. Lesley – a former accountant who has no formal medical qualifications – says two of the creams have been ruled “satisfactory”, while a third is still being analysed.  Police also quizzed her over her association with David Noakes, who is facing trial over a controversial product called GcMAF – which his company promotes as the “body’s way of becoming cancer free”. Noakes is due in court in the UK later this year on charges of money laundering and manufacturing a medicine without a licence. When the Sunday People visited Lesley at her home, which she hopes to turn into a vegan B&ampB, she insisted her cream does not contain GcMAF, despite the similar name. Lesley told us: “It’s just a name. What difference does it make? It could mean anything – multi-formula cream or whatever.” And she accused the French authorities of victimising her because she once worked with Noakes. Lesley said: “I ran a legitimate business with zero complaints from customers and positive feedback. “I don’t tell people my cream cures cancer. I don’t make any health claims. It’s not illegal to make something amazing – and it’s not illegal for others to tell the world you’ve made something amazing. One Polish woman wrote that she used my cream for tumours that had turned all fungal and said that three weeks later they were gone.  “I don’t even understand why my creams work because science says they shouldn’t work.” Lesley moved to France in 2011 after quitting her job with Noakes, which involved collating customer feedback on GcMAF. She began making her own cream three years ago. Claiming its exact contents are “a trade secret”, she would say only that it contains frankincense and yeast. Her Facebook page promoting the product stated it may help the body “defend itself against pathogens and cancers”. Facebook declined to comment on Lesley using the social networking site to promote her business. She says her business came under scrutiny by French authorities after she posted customer feedback to a private page – including the claims of the woman who said the cream had got rid of skin tumours. Lesley’s premises were raided in February last year – and she is still on bail. She said: “When I got out of prison my passport had been taken away, the banks had been cleared out and I was &pound3,000 overdrawn. “I went from having a wonderful business I loved working in, even though I was doing 70 hours a week, to having it ripped out from under me and being bankrupt – all without a single day in court. This is French justice.  “I don’t feel I’d want to support France any more, a country so abusive to human rights. It’s comparable to Turkey.” On a Facebook page to promote her cream she writes: “This not only ensures healthy skin, but may also help to enable the body to fight off infections, repair and renew its cells and defend itself against pathogens and cancers.” Lesley’s daughter Jasmin raised &pound10,000 from a crowdfunding page to help pay her mum’s legal fees. She said people had described the cream as “almost supernatural”. After her home was raided Lesley was taken to Paris, where a judge questioned her association with Noakes, who claims GcMAF can cure cancer. The so-called miracle drug contains a vitamin D binding protein called glycoprotein, which it is claimed boosts the immune system to help the body fight cancer naturally. Small clinical trials in Japan were dismissed by other experts as they did not take scans of patients’ tumours or analyse their immune systems. But online enthusiasts insist it is a “miracle cure” that is being suppressed by drugs manufacturers. The unlicensed drug is banned in the UK. GcMAF is marketed by Noakes’s Guernsey-based company, Immuno Biotech. The firm’s website claims GcMAF treats a range of conditions, from allergies and asthma to Crohn’s disease, HIV, Parkinson’s disease and autism.

title: new list hand luggage items
story: NewsNew list of hand luggage items set to be BANNED from flights leaving the UKGovernment plans could see make-up, baby powder, coffee and spices banned from hand luggage&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByElaine McCahill17:28, 7 JUL 2018Updated22:24, 7 JUL 2018NewsPowders including cosmetics or coffee could be banned from hand luggage as part of a new rules being drawn up by the government (Image: Getty Images Europe)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailEveryday items such as make-up, coffee and spices could be banned from hand luggage on all flights leaving the UK, claims a new report. The government is believed to be drawing up a new list of items that must be put in the hold. It comes after Australia, the US and New Zealand introduced similar bans last month. They adopted the new rules after Australian officials were rocked by a foiled plot to blow up an Ethiad flight from Sydney to Abu Dhabi last year. Islamic State sent the sophisticated device from Syria to a terror cell in Sydney hidden in a meat mincer.  A major terror attack may only have been averted when the suitcase was abandoned at check-in, possibly because it was too heavy. The Times reports that the new rules could bring powders under the same restrictions as liquids. All powders would be restricted to 12 ounces or 56 grams and would have to go through further security checks. The rule on liquids were introduced in the wake of 9/11. However, there are fears the new rules could mean even longer lines at airport security. It comes amid worries that the new UK passports, which are blue in colour, will increase queues at border control. The Department of Transport did not comment on The Times' report.  A spokesman said: It is for each country to determine its own security measures based on its own assessments. We work closely with all our international partners to keep aviation security under constant review. Mils Hills, an associate professor in risk, resilience and corporate security at the University of Northampton, said: In itself, these extra restrictions are not going to create a lot of disruption at airport security but it has the potential to feed into general concerns by the public about the safety of flying.

title: new ppi wave pension mis
story: NewsIs this the new PPI? Wave of pension mis-selling could spark windfall for thousandsDuped savers could each pocket £50,000 due to their underperforming pension schemes&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByPippa Allen-Kinross11:52, 7 JUL 2018Updated13:52, 7 JUL 2018NewsSenior woman inserting coins into piggybank (Image: Getty)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailDuped savers could each pocket a &pound50,000 windfall due to their underperforming pension schemes as part of a mammoth SIPP scandal engulfing the UK - which industry experts fear will overtake the current wave of PPI claims. A colossal &pound10 billion worth of badly performing SIPPs - Self Invested Personal Pensions - are believed to have been mis-sold to hundreds of thousands of Brits by unscrupulous financial advisors. Now potential victims are being urged to check if they can reclaim huge portions of their lost cash and the government has set up a special &pound120 million fund to compensate losers so far. A maximum &pound50,000 compensation sum is currently available from the large fund managed by The Financial Service Compensation Scheme and the figure is set to rise by 75 per cent to a &pound85,000 maximum in the next nine months as claims grow. However industry figures such as pension expert Zoe Pearson warn that the true cost of mis-sold pensions is closer to &pound10 billion and will sweep the country like the current phenomenon of PPI claims that has gripped the nation over the past few years.  Read more: Taxed to death: The astonishing amount of income tax people pay decades after leaving work for the last time Miss Pearson, who heads the country’s all female team of claim specialists Pension Claim Consulting Ltd , told : “Thousands upon thousands of people are unaware they’ve been mis-sold SIPPS. Unless you know what to look for it’s difficult to know what a mis-sale is although quite often when people realise they’ve been mis-sold to, they’re too embarrassed to take action. “However, the financial services industry has firm rules, so any mis-sale should be pursued. “Even basic calculations give you an idea of the true scale of this scandal. Average compensation for mis-sales sit at around &pound25,000 for private pensions and &pound50,000 for final salary pensions so the total figure for the mis-sales of SIPPs is going to be around the &pound10bn mark. “In fact if this was brought to the forefront and the government advised people to check the status of their pensions that might even be an underestimation. The government needs to launch an investigation to unearth the true amount.” Labour MP Frank Field has hit out at the SIPP conmen and vowed to bring the industry into line whilst industry experts reveal the true figure of mis-selling is growing at an unprecedented rate and the true loss of mis-selling will run into billions as the number of victims rocket.  Shocking 30.4million Brits face disappointment when they finally get to stop working - the plan to fix it The Financial Ombudsman however are allowed to raise their compensation ceiling and can award up to a further maximum of &pound150,000 for many cases. The SIPP scams involved unscrupulous Financial Advisors preying on savers who were promised massive returns of up to 20 per cent a year only for their savings to be squandered on get rich quick schemes including investing in airport parking, holiday properties and green energy projects. The Financial Conduct Authority revealed one in eight savers think an advisor has mis-sold them a financial product such as a pension. The FCA advise people who think they have been mis-sold a pension to raise a complaint as soon as possible as there are time-limits in place which could affect the outcome of your claim. Their report called the Financial Lives Survey was widely praised by industry experts who believe that the government have underestimated the scale of mis-sold pensions such as SIPPs however the Commons Work and Pensions Committee have demanded tighter safeguards to protect savers. Committee Chairman Frank Field MP said: “I am concerned about the role of SIPPs as platforms that help funnel unwitting clients’ pension savings into dodgy and inappropriate investments. SIPPs are happy to skim off their fee on the way but there are serious questions about their commitment to due diligence and consumer protection. “When an unscrupulous financial advisor channels a victim’s money through a SIPP into an investment that then collapses, it is not enough for the SIPP provider to shrug their shoulders and say ‘caveat emptor’. “I will be writing to the FCA to ask what they are doing to ensure SIPPS are not acting as handmaidens to the pension-snatchers.”

title: owners urged check dogs eyes
story: NewsOwners urged to check their dogs’ eyes or risk them going blindDry eyes is a common condition that can lead to infections, ulcers and even eyes being removed – but only half of ­owners are aware of it&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByRachel Spencer19:06, 7 JUL 2018NewsA dog with dried eyes&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailOwners are being urged to check their dogs’ eyes or risk them going blind. Dry eyes is a common condition that can lead to infections, ulcers and even eyes being removed – but only half of &shyowners are aware of it. Nicole Paprotny, 30, had to have both her pet’s eyes removed after he was diagnosed. Nicole said: “It was &shyheartbreaking. It was a last resort to get my happy &shypuppy back.” The first symptom her &shylabrador boxer cross Scully showed was conjunctivitis. Despite various treatments, he stopped producing tears. He had &shysurgery to direct his salivary glands to his eyes but this failed so he lost his left eye. Then, two months later, the condition hit his right eye.  Nicole, a vet nurse from Tranent, near Edinburgh, chose to lose the eye rather than have him put to sleep. She said: “Scully now navigates his way around home with his sense of smell and senses where &shyobstacles are.” One in five vulnerable breeds and one in 20 of all dogs suffer with dry eye at some stage in their life. Symptoms include eyes appearing red and sore, repeated cases of &shyconjunctivitis, excessive blinking or eye rubbing, discharge and eyes &shyhaving a dry and dull appearance. Trendy breeds such as pugs and bulldogs with eyes that pop out are more at risk, as are cocker and cavalier King Charles spaniels, westies, and pekingese pups.

title: pippa middleton reveals one thing
story: NewsPippa Middleton reveals the one thing she's refusing to give up during her pregnancyPippa Middleton is expecting her first child with husband James Matthews&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByZoe ForseyAudience Writer17:36, 6 JUL 2018NewsPippa is pregnant with her first child (Image: Rex)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailWhen women find out they're pregnant, their lives change forever. Even though they're still months away from meeting their baby, the changes to their day-to-day life start immediately. There's a whole host of foods they can no longer eat, they can't drink and they will sometimes have to give up the hobbies they love. But there's one thing Pippa Middleton, who is expecting her first child with husband James Matthews, is refusing to give up despite that growing baby bump.   Writing in her column for Waitrose Weekend , the Duchess of Cambridge's little sister, 34, explains why she is still playing tennis.  She said: I've been a tennis fan since childhood, as player and spectator, and have been keen to continue playing safely throughout pregnancy. Take Serena Williams – she famously proved that women can play a high level of tennis from two months (when she won the 2017 Australian Open) up to eight months. Few of us can relate to this elite excellence, but if you're a healthy, well-trained player with an uncomplicated pregnancy there's no reason why you can't continue a good level of tennis.  It is believed Pippa is due in October. And it's not just playing which Pippa enjoys, and she's a regular at Wimbledon. She was in the crowds for day four of this year's competition with her brother James.

title: sisters shocking whatsapp messages mum
story: NewsSisters' shocking WhatsApp messages while mum lay dying in faeces-strewn bed crawling with maggotsCatherine Purcell died after daughter's "extreme neglect" in Kirkby, Liverpool&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByNeil DockingMark Chandler17:12, 7 JUL 2018Updated18:21, 7 JUL 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA woman shared shocking messages with her sister as their dying mum lay in a faeces-strewn bed that was crawling with maggots.  Catherine Purcell, 68, died while being eaten alive and lying in a “cesspit of her own faeces and bodily fluid” at the home she shared with her daughter in Kirkby, Liverpool .  This week, her husband John Purcell, 72, and 35-year-old daughter Catherine Purcell junior, 35, were given suspended jail sentences for neglecting the disabled great-grandmother.  Prosecutors said the great-grandmother's bed was so soiled it had been chemically destroyed by her own bodily fluids, the Liverpool Echo reported.   David McLachlan, QC, prosecuting, said this reaction burned the skeletal victim’s skin and her infected body was then fed on by maggots. He argued during that the pair knew she was dying, but failed to seek medical aid, which three weeks beforehand would have saved her life. During the harrowing trial into the death of Mrs Purcell, Mr McLachlan read out messages exchanged between Purcell junior and her sister Kellie, who had not visited the house for six months and was not charged with any offences. The messages were sent days before the pensioner died on July 11, 2016, and included Purcell junior likening her mum to a pig lying in s***.  One message read: Ye girl co dad said fore to just ignore her for a bit and let her do with put cuppa tea and biffs let’s see if she’ll give in that way but every time one of us walk in she gets worse surly she can smell it in her f***ing hands when she smoking Oh I jus don’t know what to do coz she can’t walk so I can’t even get her to the bath room to giv her a bath and no matter what way we look at her were gona end up with this all over use as well even if she could walk she’s gonna have us plasted in s*** as well she’s just not assed to say the least girl either she isn’t a bit bothered that she’s like that she licks off if we tell he to at least wash her hands to eat her tea etc. She f***ing flipped on dad av few times now coz she’s had to get wash she like pig lying in her Own s*** descusting I feel like f***ing dragging her by the head and f***ing throwing her in the f***ing bath tats how bad she is girl.  In one text, Kellie Purcell asked: Have u sorted little room yet girl I got bedding for single and double here just finishing sorting curtain now sweat p***ing out of me like tap carnt breath &amp I stink. Her sister replied: No have I f*** girl I can’t be assed what’s the point am going to jail any how so dads keeps telling me. The f***ing point is it needs doing oh I be round in morning, came the reply. Other messages appeared to show Kellie Purcell offering to help out but being repeatedly ignored by her sister.  And she lashed out at her sibling in another message, accusing her of pure laziness for not helping their mum. She wrote: I agree about mum if use would of let Carers in u would have been better but the state the house is in cath and me mum got f*** all to do with not being able to cope it pure laziness. A post-mortem examination found Mrs Purcell died from pneumonia, dehydration and skin ulcers, including a hip ulcer penetrating to the bone.  The victim, who weighed just five and a half stone, also had undiagnosed cancer of the tongue, which would have made swallowing painful. Mr Purcell claimed he didn’t realise his wife was “severely malnourished”, or her stained legs covered in sores, despite changing her clothes. He accepted her bedroom was “disgraceful”, but said he didn’t know it was that filthy until she died, because the bed was covered by a duvet.

title: suspected new banksy artwork appears
story: NewsSuspected new Banksy artwork appears in Birmingham streetThe elusive artist is famous for his provocative graffiti pieces appearing suddenly in public locations&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByTony LarnerPippa Allen-Kinross09:54, 8 JUL 2018NewsMystery surrounds Banksy's real identity (Image: Bristol Post WS)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A stunning artwork which has suddenly appeared on a wall in Birmingham is thought to be the latest piece from elusive graffiti artist Banksy .  The image, which appeared in Digbeth, shows a little girl sat on the ground in dark clothes and frowning, while holding a red heart-shaped balloon with the word 'tame' written on it. It has been painted on a wall in the heavily graffitied Floodgate Street, in Birmingham's 'creative quarter'.  Birmingham Live reported that one local who photographed the image on his way to work said: This has only just been painted. I think it is a Banksy as the pure level of detail in the work speaks volumes. The Custard Factory, a nearby independent shopping centre and with creative workspaces, posted a photograph of the new artwork on Instagram with the caption 'Is this who we think it is?!' Banksy, a graffiti artist, political activist and film director, has made headlines across the world for his iconic and often controversial pieces for over a decade. Las year rapper Goldie hinted at the artist's true identity, during an interview with spoken word poet Scroobius Pip, for his Distraction Pieces podcast.  The drum and bass legend was being interviewed for the podcast when he referred to the elusive artist as 'Robert .  It is thought to be confirmation that Banksy is his friend Robert Del Naja - a member of Massive Attack. Del Naja - known as 3D - is a pal of the hip hop star and they were both graffiti artists in the same circles in the late 1980s. In the podcast Goldie is ranting about how the art industry is cashing in on Banksy. He says: Give me a bubble letter and put it on a t-shirt and write 'Banksy' on it and we're sorted. We can sell it now. No disrespect to Robert, I think he is a brilliant artist.

title: thrifty shoppers score cheap out
story: NewsThrifty shoppers score cheap out-of-date food delivered to save cash – and cut wasteThousands of products – including pasta, biscuits, crisps and cake bars – past their “best before” dates are being snapped up at bargain prices&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByStephen Hayward21:48, 7 JUL 2018Updated09:11, 8 JUL 2018NewsThe new service is operated by Fultons Foods, which hopes it will reduce the amount of perfectly usable produce that gets binned (Image: Getty)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThrifty shoppers are getting cheap out-of-date food delivered to save cash – and cut waste. Thousands of products – including pasta, biscuits, crisps and cake bars – past their “best before” dates are being snapped up at bargain prices. The new service is operated by Fultons Foods, which hopes it will reduce the amount of perfectly usable produce that gets binned. An astonishing seven million tonnes of food is thrown away in the UK every year, of which three-&shyquarters, or five million tonnes, could still have been safely eaten. Family-run Fultons, which is based in Barnsley, South Yorks, operates 100 stores in the Midlands and North. It sells surplus stock direct from manufacturers at “significantly” lower prices than supermarkets.  The firm’s Karen Gunter said: “An increasing number of UK householders are saving hundreds of pounds by taking advantage of the reality of best before dates. These products are perfectly fine to eat.” “Best before” is a manufacturer’s indication that an item may not be as good quality, but it is not unsafe. Bargains include roast chicken and pasta Mug Shot down from 84p to 29p, Galaxy cake bars down from &pound1 to 79p, bottles of 7 Up lemonade down from &pound1.10 to 59p, and Golden Wonder salt and vinegar crisps from 79p to 50p.  Deliveries, which are made by couriers, are free for groceries costing &pound30 or over. Online retailer Approved Food runs a similar scheme offering 2,000 items near or past “best before” dates. It claims regular customers can save &pound70 on their monthly shop compared to high street prices. The firm’s biggest-selling items include tinned tomatoes and pasta.

title: topless footie fans pile car
story: NewsTopless footie fans pile on car bonnet to celebrate England win but one falls off and is run overThe footage begins by showing the two men cheering as they leisurely sit on the car bonnet&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByAmber Hicks23:14, 7 JUL 2018NewsThe topless men can be seen raising their beverages as they pass the crowds on the car bonnet&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTwo England fans who sat on a car bonnet as it paraded them down a street following the Three Lions' win have been berated after a little girl was almost run over. title: ways england fans quarter final
story: NewsAll the ways England fans' quarter final World Cup celebrations are going badly wrongOne man has been seen leaping off a double decker bus in London onto a bus stop glass roof - and it doesn't end well&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByAmber Hicks19:59, 7 JUL 2018Updated21:22, 7 JUL 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAn England football fan has come crashing through the glass roof of a bus stop in London after his World Cup celebration went very wrong. He is among millions around the country enjoying the Three Lion's glorious 2-0 victory against Sweden in the World Cup quarter-finals this evening. But not all the celebrations have exactly gone according to plan. In Clapham Junction the jumper joined hundreds lining the streets in the sizzling sunshine chanting and clapping to mark Harry Kane and his team making history. The man - dressed in a blue top and shorts and evidently bursting with pride - clambers on top of a double decker bus and can be seen in a video swinging his arms chanting 'ooh ooh.' He encourages the crowd to join in as he leads the celebrations.  There are cheers as he and another man, dressed in a red top, dance on top of the double deck bus and nearby bus stop roof. And they can be seen swinging their arms, jumping and dancing as they soak up the atmosphere - until the man in blue leaps from the bus onto the bus stop and smashes through the glass roof. The clapping stops and gasps can be heard as he lands smack on the concrete in his side. But miraculously in true Brit style he gets up and walks it off. The glass roof is left hanging, while the man in red - still on the top of the bus stop - appears to question how he can get down safely and avoid the same fate as his pal.  The video which has been posted online has received mixed reactions. One person said: Love how he got up and styled it out, nothing to see here!! Another added: How did he just walk it off. While Brian Kane wrote: The guy with the hat just keeps on clapping as if nothing happened. However, some think he's gone too far.  Meanwhile, in Southampton a man has been caught surfing across three MOVING double decker buses to celebrate England's win.

title: woman kept children stinking house
story: NewsWoman kept children in stinking house of horrors among human wasteClaire Greenley, 35, said she would 'fight' police when she was told officers were coming to rescue the children in her care&nbspShareBySimon BristowElaine McCahill19:14, 7 JUL 2018NewsClaire Greenly kept children in a house of horrors with human excrement smeared on the walls (Image: Facebook)&nbspShareGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA woman kept children in a stinking house of horrors with human waste smeared on the walls, a court has heard. Claire Greenley, 35, even said police would have a fight on their hands and the street would help out when she was told officers were on their way to rescue the children. Hull Crown Court heard how the youngsters who were in Ms Greenley's care were left in squalid conditions with human excrement smeared on the sink, windows, walls and stairs. The children, who cannot be named for legal reasons, were found to have suffered emotional and psychological harm and are now recovering, reports Hull Live.   Megan Rhys, prosecuting, said when authorities visited the east Hull property last year, the garden was strewn with furniture and rubbish from split black bin bags. The real horrors were inside the house, where Greenley was found unkempt and smelling unpleasant, as if she had not been looking after herself. The house was filled with bags and piles of dirty clothes, to the point where it was difficult to find floor space not covered by rubbish. The bathroom door was off its hinges, and inside was a 2.5ft high pile of soiled clothing. The floor was barely visible, Miss Rhys said. There was faecal matter on the sink unit and three to four human stools on the stairs, which had dried and clearly been there for some time and stepped in. The visitors also found faeces smeared on the wall of a bedroom.  An upstairs window and the letter box had also been smeared with excrement, the court heard. An inspector said it was the worst property he'd seen in ten years. Miss Rhys said: It's difficult to say how long the property had been in that state. It's clearly not something that had happened overnight. When Greenley was interviewed by police, she accepted the house was uninhabitable. Greenley, who had no previous convictions, later admitted child cruelty offences. Cathrine Kioko-Gilligan, mitigating, said Greenley had previously been the victim of domestic violence, and suffered mental health problems after the breakdown of that relationship.  Her home became unmanageable and she was too ashamed and embarrassed to seek assistance. Sentencing Greenley, Judge David Tremberg said the house was comprehensively unfit for human habitation, and was squalid and unkempt from top to bottom, with the smell and presence of faeces about the place.

title: world cup loving bride watches
story: NewsWorld Cup-loving bride watches England football match while making her marriage vowsNadine Hanlon made sure she didn't miss England's quarter final win over Sweden, saying 'I love the man, but football comes first'&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByPippa Allen-Kinross10:30, 8 JUL 2018Updated10:31, 8 JUL 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A football-mad bride has made sure she didn't miss a moment of England' s victory over Sweden by screening the match on her special day.   Nadine Hanlon, 43, and husband Lee, 40, put the World Cup on a big screen next to the top table while they enjoyed their wedding breakfast.   The couple, who live in Rutland, have been married for 21 years and were renewing their vows in Yorkshire on Saturday, but Nadine - who wore a full wedding dress for the ceremony - wasn't going to let that stop her from supporting the team.  She said: It's a great day because we've renewed our vows but even better than that, it's topped off - England won. The boys are bringing it back home.  I knew they were going to win, I have faith. Asked why she was determined to screen the match during her special day, she said: Because I can't function without watching the game. I love the man, but footballs comes first. However, Nadine - who has an Arsenal tattoo on her leg - is far more enthusiastic about the game than her soldier husband Lee. It's the wrong shaped ball. He's a rugby guy, she said.

title: voice sunday mirror can proud
story: NewsopinionVoice of the Sunday Mirror: We can be so proud of our World Cup football teamThe England team has done it with such good manners, courtesy and sportsmanship, they are a credit to their country and an example to the world&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByVoice of the Mirror23:16, 7 JUL 2018Updated23:18, 7 JUL 2018NewsopinionEngland team manager Gareth Southgate celebrates after England beat Sweden and go through to the semi-finals (Image: Andy Stenning/Daily Mirror)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIn his private moments before leaving for Russia, Gareth Southgate did not have high hopes for this World Cup. The England coach told friends he thought we stood a much better chance in 2022 in Qatar. He knew he was fielding a young, inexperienced squad up against teams who had more international caps under their belts. But he said there was one thing his players had going for them. All they ever wanted to do was go out there and play football. Their heads had not been turned by the trappings of fame, and their minds were fixed on the beautiful game. The lads have played football more beautifully than anyone could have dreamed of. To beat the England curse of the penalty shootout would have been enough for them to return home as heroes. To beat Sweden 2-0 in yesterday’s quarter-finals made them superheroes.  The squad some thought wouldn’t get out of their group will now go forward to the first semi-final with England in it since 1990. It is a magnificent achievement, and gave a nation worn down by the angst of austerity and the boredom of Brexit a spring in its step. Or as the BBC so soberly put it, Harry Maguire’s header “sent them batty in Birmingham” and Dele Alli’s goal “bonkers on Brighton beach”. And the England team has done it with such good manners, courtesy and sportsmanship, they are a credit to their country and an example to the world. Put heat on Putin Now we can dare to dream of England in another World Cup final – an event the prime minister and a senior royal would be expected to attend. Not this time. Not with Dawn Sturgess lying unconscious in hospital kept alive on a ventilator. Dawn and boyfriend Charlie Rowley were the innocent victims of one of Vladimir Putin’s death squads. An assassination team operating on British soil clearly still contaminated with their vicious poison. We accept that Mr Putin has staged a well-managed World Cup.

title: empty roads during england vs
story: NewsEmpty roads during England vs Sweden World Cup match shows a football-mad country as you've never seen itWhile football fans were in the pub, plenty of people were taking advantage of the empty roads and supermarkets&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByZahra MulroySocial Audience Editor18:34, 7 JUL 2018Updated18:37, 7 JUL 2018NewsBliss (Image: Tel: +44 191 265 7624)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailEarlier today an almost spooky change took hold of the UK. It might be July, it might be the hottest weekend of the year so far, but large swathes of the country appeared to be completely deserted. In this instance, the reason wasn't a zombie apocalypse, nor the outbreak of some terrible virus.  Instead, it was the 3pm England vs Sweden match in Samara, Russia.  While the pubs were heaving, the roads (especially in and out of the capital) were completely empty.  It's no wonder. 23.8 million viewers tuned in to watch England's clash with Colombia, and it's expected that 30 million tuned in to watch England's 2-0 victory today. If there was anywhere you wanted to go, today was the day to make that journey.  And plenty of non-fans (and football widows) took advantage of this. In towns around the country, life seemed to grind to a standstill as fans flocked to pubs or headed home to watch the match.

story: NewsSneaky football-mad wedding guests resort to desperate measures to watch England vs SwedenIt's not an ideal day to get hitched, luckily there are some understanding brides and grooms&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByZahra MulroySocial Audience Editor16:09, 7 JUL 2018Updated16:59, 7 JUL 2018NewsIt's a big day for England (Image: REUTERS)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe sun may be shining and the mood may be optimistic, but that doesn't change the fact that it's probably the worst day of the year (so far) to get married.
